intro: Monogynella lupuliformis, commonly known as the yellow wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial shade. Its botanical features include small, delicate petals and a distinctive seed capsule that splits open to release seeds. Monogynella lupuliformis is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
